oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Death
Funeral rites and ceremonies
Religion
Egypt--Antiquities
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Book of Breathing written for a woman named Heryet, whose mother was named Tapelyet. Thirteen columns of text demarcated by black lines. There is some significant damage to the first column, which is blackened. Painted vignettes appear above the text. Unfortunately, damage to the upper section of the papyrus destroyed many of the scenes, leaving traces above column 1 and fully preserved scenes above columns 10-13. The Book of Breathing is an Ancient Egyptian funerary text.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Book of Breathing
